Class View

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.backpackhero.item.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
CombatInteractionDelegate
public class View extends Object implements CombatInteractionDelegate
Console-based interaction class responsible for handling all user input and displaying the state of the BackPack and combat choices.

  • Method Details

    • testCurseScenario

      public void testCurseScenario(int numItemsToRoll)
      Executes a demo scenario for item placement and forced curse handling. 1. Places a specified number of random items interactively. 2. Forces the placement of a Curse item.
      Parameters:
      numItemsToRoll - The number of random items to generate before the curse.

    • handleForcedCurse

      public void handleForcedCurse(Heros heros, Curse curse)
      Description copied from interface: CombatInteractionDelegate
      Handles the complete interaction when an enemy forces a Curse onto the Hero. This typically involves asking the player to accept or refuse the curse.
      Specified by:
      handleForcedCurse in interface CombatInteractionDelegate
      Parameters:
      heros - The Hero affected by the curse.
      curse - The Curse object being inflicted.

    • handleForcedCurse

      public void handleForcedCurse(Heros heros, Curse curse, Scanner scanner)
      Implementation of the CombatInteractionDelegate interface. Handles the forced Curse interaction initiated by an enemy during combat.
      Parameters:
      heros - The Hero targeted by the curse.
      curse - The Curse object to be handled.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if heros or curse is null.

    • printBackPack

      public static void printBackPack(BackPack backpack)
      Displays the current state of the backpack in a grid format to the console. * @param backpack The backpack to display.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

    • editBackPack

      public void editBackPack(BackPack backpack, StuffFactory factory)
      Enters an interactive loop mode allowing the user to find and place items indefinitely.
      Parameters:
      backpack - The backpack to modify.
      factory - The factory to create random items.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if arguments are null.

    • processItemRemoval

      public void processItemRemoval(Scanner scanner)
      Executes the removal logic based on the target position, distinguishing between a Curse (forced destruction/penalty) and a normal Item (choice to discard/reserve).
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object for interaction.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if scanner is null.
